TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit TabRenderer extends System.Object
public ref class TabRenderer abstract sealed
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TabRenderer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides methods used to render a tab control with visual styles. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a tab control with the current visual style of the operating system. Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control. This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style. To draw a tab control, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> method to draw the page, and use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> method to draw each tab.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, the methods of this class will draw the tab control with the current visual style. Otherwise, the methods and properties of this class will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>. To determine whether the members of this class can be used, check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.
This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=nameWithType> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Tab?displayProperty=nameWithType> class. For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom control that uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods to draw a basic tab control with two tabs.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer/cpp/form1.cpp#0)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer/CS/form1.cs#0)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer/VB/form1.vb#0)]

Docs.summary: Draws a tab that is used to select a page in the tab control.

-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsSupported { get; }
.property bool IsSupported
Public Shared ReadOnly Property IsSupported As Boolean
public: static property bool IsSupported { bool get(); };
member this.IsSupported : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the class can be used to draw a tab control with visual styles.
Docs.value: if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property to determine whether to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer.DrawTabItem%2A> methods. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabRenderer> class.
